result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected

miscConds.notes:
Joint/severally with co=defts
Bond applied  -  PAID IN FULL

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $250  plus surcharges joint/severally.   
May not have contact with Travis Herzog, Austin Lynn, Serena Mahmudi, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any firearms.

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Meg O'Marro. DE's father, Terrence Smith, present in court.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  152 - Sentence recommendations. Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $250 - order signed this day. Ct1:  Defendant is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 1 year of Extended Supervision - IMPOSED AND STAYED. Defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions. 74 days sentence credit if revoked. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs ordered - due over term of probation. Ct2:  Defendant is sentenced to 6 months in the Kenosha County Jail - IMPOSED AND STAYED.  Defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to Ct1. 74 days sentence credit if revoked. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs ordered - due over term of probation. Bond may be applied toward costs. Voters rights, Firearms warning, Appeal rights given. (ps 9/15/16)

Sentencing hearing on September 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence J Smith appeared with Attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes: Atty Alberti has been retained by the DE; Court dismisses Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  ST called witness  PPPD Ofc Michael Algiers; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Alberti. Information filed and read by ADA Graveley. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
